alert.note: Alert for Moniteau (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:37PM CDT until August 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COLE...SOUTHERN BOONE AND NORTHERN MONITEAU COUNTIES... At 836 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Prairie Home, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Jefferson City, California, Ashland, Tipton, Columbia Regional Airport, St. Martins, Jamestown, Clarksburg, Centertown, Easley, McGirk, Marion, Hartsburg, Lupus, McBaine, Elston, Sandy Hook, Wilton, and Kliever. This also includes Rock Bridge State Park and Jewell Cemetery Historic Site. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
